column4: Is there a way of getting esd to listen on TCP publically? It seems to ignore /etc/esound/esd.conf
And the sound configuration just has a tick box to enable automatically starting esd.
you killed esd and restarted it?
I can kill it and restart it manually with my choice of switches, yes.
It doesn't open a public port by default.  I want to change that.  If I kill the one it starts, and start my own with the right switches, it works.
what did you add to esd.conf?
I could, if I had any idea what it was. :)
Another implementation of a mixer that's ESD compat.
OK.  Say I use that.  How do you tell Gnome to use that instead? :)
OK.  polypaudio.  How do you actually get it to listen on TCP?
Running with -tcp -public -promiscuous doesn't, and I've changed its config file such that it loads the esound-tcp module.
google for it and it should help
